title: Social Task Simulation Instructional Design Based on Bloom's Cognitive Taxonomy

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary education-level foundational sociology knowledge and job experience
context.additional_context: Customized training for workplace professionals to enhance social sector job competencies

learning_goals: Learners can design job simulation scenarios by utilizing Bloom's revised taxonomy six cognitive levels (Remember-Understand-Apply-Analyze-Evaluate-Create).
Learners can demonstrate decision-making processes applying higher-order thinking skills (Analyze-Evaluate-Create) through social conflict resolution simulations in VR environments.
Learners can verify whether designed instructional scenarios reflect diverse cognitive levels of Bloom's taxonomy through peer assessment.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
